alert.note: Alert for Colleton; Hampton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 16 at 9:10PM EDT until August 16 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR COLLETON AND HAMPTON COUNTIES... At 907 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with torrential rains extending from Early Branch east to Hendersonville, Walterboro, Neyles and Gloverville with a secondary area of thunderstorms near Crocketville. As much as 2 to 6 inches of rain has already fallen across parts of the warned area. An additional 1 to 3 inches could fall through 1030 PM. Flash flooding is likely in some areas. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Walterboro, Hampton, Yemassee, Varnville, Cottageville, Hendersonville, Ritter, Islandton, Early Branch, Cummings, Round O, Almeda Intersection, Crocketville, Colleton Medical Center, Thayer, Drawdy, Lowcountry Regional Airport, Davidson, Fechtig and Neyles. If living along Ireland Creek in Walterboro, keep an eye out on water levels and be prepared to seek higher ground if the creek overflows its banks and flash flooding occurs. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR AND 30 MINUTES
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
